comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message indicating that a domain entered is incorrect. It is commonly displayed in a dialog or notification when a user attempts to access a trusted mail account with an invalid domain. The translated version of this message should appear next to "Incorrect domain" on the screen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation "Domaine incorrecte" is grammatically incorrect. "Domaine" is masculine, so the adjective "incorrecte" should be "incorrect".

The Korean translation "유효하지 않은 도메인입니다" (yu-hw-o-ha-ji a-neun do-mein-im-ni-da) translates to 'It is an invalid domain.' While technically correct, it lacks the brevity and directness of "Incorrect domain." A more accurate and concise translation would be "잘못된 도메인입니다".

The Sinhala translation 'වැරදි වසමකි' while literally meaning 'incorrect scope/area' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Incorrect domain'. 'Domain' in this context likely refers to a digital domain (website, etc.).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: වැරදි අඩවිය (Waeradi Adhiya) - Incorrect website/site; or වැරදි පරිවරණය (Waeradi Pariwaranya) - Incorrect Domain (more technical)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "域不正确" is technically correct, a more natural and common translation of "Incorrect domain" in Chinese would be something like "域名不正确" (míng yíng bù zhèng què).  "域" (yù) refers to a broader area, whereas "域名" (míng yíng) specifically refers to a domain name.
